channel.title: [IN PROGRESS] Rename IRC Chat Button
channel.description:
I think part of the problem is that new members may have no idea what IRC Chat is, and as such may be discouraged to click that button.
Renaming to Live Chat, IM Chat, or just Chat might lead to more activity in IRC? Who knows.

item.title: [IN PROGRESS] Rename IRC Chat Button
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Null Amount, post:21, topic:530057”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=648815.msg4363093#msg4363093 date=1379141818]
Slightly off topic but on a side note: I tried using an IRC Client for android to connect and ‘/join moparscape’ but I am always told it doesnt exist, so not sure whats going on there.

On topic: I like ‘IM Chat’ the best. Its slightly unprofessional but it sounds more welcoming then ‘Live Chat’ (sounds like a damn customer support line) and ‘Chat’ just seems plain to me.
[/quote]You need to do /join #moparscape[/quote]
Shortly after posting this I found an IRC chat client that worked without needing the # put into the name. Was on for a few but got back off.

Read full topic

item.title: [IN PROGRESS] Rename IRC Chat Button

item.description:

[quote=“Frell, post:13, topic:530057”]“IRC Chat” isn’t a good name. Its basically “Internet Relay Chat Chat”

We should just make it “IRC”

Thanks for pointing that out David[/quote]

Or just ‘Chat’.

Read full topic

item.title: [IN PROGRESS] Rename IRC Chat Button
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“casey., post:9, topic:530057”]overwhelming? Sorry if you can’t comprehend that topic(even with pictures) than you are never going to go anywhere in both programming nor contribution to irc.[/quote]I just mean in terms of clicking the chat button and then it not linking to the chat, idunno. Could just have your instructions below the chat client on the web page.

Read full topic

item.title: [IN PROGRESS] Rename IRC Chat Button
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“casey., post:7, topic:530057”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=648815.msg4362356#msg4362356 date=1379011067]
I think changing the webpage itself might be useful. Having the instructions on using your own IRC client, or explanation of what IRC is, how to use it, etc. Right now people can click the link and not see the instructions thread and have no idea what they are doing.
[/quote]
Perhaps it could be redirected to my IRC topic. I’m sure I could find time to update it and make it user-friendly.[/quote]I thought of that, but I’m not sure if that would be productive or counter productive. Giving them a slightly overwhelming topic before they even get to the chat, they may just say ‘fuck it’.

Read full topic

item.title: [IN PROGRESS] Rename IRC Chat Button
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

Davidi2:

I think changing the webpage itself might be useful. Having the instructions on using your own IRC client, or explanation of what IRC is, how to use it, etc. Right now people can click the link and not see the instructions thread and have no idea what they are doing.

Perhaps it could be redirected to my IRC topic. I’m sure I could find time to update it and make it user-friendly.

Read full topic

Having the instructions on using your own IRC client, or explanation of what IRC is, how to use it, etc. Right now people can click the link and not see the instructions thread and have no idea what they are doing.

item.title: [IN PROGRESS] Rename IRC Chat Button
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

We’re looking to modernize the IRC client anyway, whether that be customizing what we have, or bringing in another client applet. I like the idea and it is a small change that should be considered.
